name: rubber
content:
rubber noun
(SUBSTANCE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 [ U ] an elastic substance (= that stretches) made either from the juice of particular tropical trees or artificially: Tyres are almost always made of rubber.
A2 [ C ] UK an
eraser mainly US
subjug/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
[ C ] US slang for a
condom
[ C ] in baseball, a strip of rubber on a mound (= raised area) that the foot of the pitcher must be touching when they start to throw the ball: He likes to pitch from the far left side of the rubber. rubbers [ plural ] US
old-fashioned for
overshoes : It looks like rain so you might want to wear your rubbers.
See more
More examplesFewer examplesMost tyres are made of rubber compounded with other chemicals and materials.The chemical industry produces such things as petrochemicals, drugs, paint and rubber.Sunlight has caused the rubber to perish.These toys are made of pliant rubber, so they won't break.This rubber ball is very resilient and immediately springs back into shape.

rubber noun
(GAME)
[ C ] a series of three or five games between two teams, especially in card games or cricket: We played a rubber of bridge.

Idiom

Add to word list
Add to word list
an elastic, waterproof substance made either from the juice of a tree that grows in hotter parts of the world or artificially: [ U ] rubber boots/gloves [ U ] Tires are made of rubber.
Br A rubber is an eraser.
Rubbers are waterproof shoes made of rubber, which are worn over regular shoes to keep them dry: [ pl ] Wear your rubbers – it’s raining.
